CommandQueue.name: CommandQueue
CommandQueue.description: Schdule and execute Commands in a CommandQueue

GameComponent.name: GameComponent
GameComponent.description:
Super class of any game component.  These game components are always initialised with the game's setup file and a signal dispatcher.
This allows all game components (eg. ReelsComponent or WinLinesComponent) to access game setup and dispatch and receive events from other
areas of the application

Reel.name: Reel
Reel.description:
One Reel defined by this class. Contains a sprite map for mapping sprite ids to symbol sprites.
Sets up and executes the spin animation Tween when reels are spun.
Stops the tween when spinning is ended and signals to the ReelComponent.

ReelsComponent.name: ReelsComponent
ReelsComponent.description: GameComponent responsible for drawing symbols to each reel and spinning them.

Game.name: Game
Game.description:
Initialises preloading of assets, stores Setup, GameState, and GameComponents
GameComponents are added to Stage
Wires ServerInterface to GameComponents using a SignalDispatcher
User Interface Events can defined set here.

Preloader.name: Preloader
Preloader.description:
Preloader is responsible loading Setup and assets into the Game.
These include sounds, spritesheets, and data in the form of json files
It will then dispatch Signals (Events) back to the Game for notification and safe caching of assets.

ServerInterface.name: ServerInterface
ServerInterface.description: Makes calls to the Server and receives messages.  It then calls the signal dispatcher to dispatch necessary events to GameComponents

SignalDispatcher.name: SignalDispatcher
SignalDispatcher.description: Central Hub for providing Signals for the app to dispatch and listen to.

QueueFactory.name: QueueFactory
QueueFactory.description: Constructs queues for the CommandQueue for the purpose of displaying winning animations

Main.name: Main
Main.description:
The Main Class should give the app its entry point.
No other entry points should be used by the index.html

classitems.description: initialise game data and component
classitems.name: init

classitems.description: Set to any value other than 0 to make the Queue loop back to this command when finished
classitems.name: loopIndex

classitems.description: duration of time in millis to allow this command to execute
classitems.name: callNextDelay

classitems.description: Saves reference to Setup and creates a QueueFactory
classitems.name: init

classitems.description: Initialise a queue ready for playing
classitems.name: setupQueue

classitems.description: Plays the current queue, defined during setupQueue function.
classitems.name: play

classitems.description:
executes the currently queued command and schedules a timeout to call the next in queue
or finishes if at the end of the queue, or loops back (loops back to first command in queue with a loopIndex).
classitems.name: executeNext

classitems.description: clears any timeouts and prepares class for a new queue.
classitems.name: flushQueue

classitems.description: Hide Previously drawn winLines and show more winLines.

classitems.description:
Dynamically alter the speed of reels by changing this percentage:
eg. 0.5 = half speed reels
Maximum Speed the reels can spin in pixels per second
Number of reels currently spinning

Spins all reels with a delay configuration from setup.json
Stops reels if they are currently spinning.
Clear any winline/animation overlays
Play Spin Sound

classitems.description:
DOM events
for development only

classitems.description: the spritesheet data for symbol win animations loaded by Preloader
classitems.name: symbolAnims

classitems.description: Scale the symbols by this amount, determined by the scale reduction (n) used in Texturepacker to the ratio 1/n
classitems.name: SCALE_FACTOR

classitems.description: Stored reference to symbols, top left is 0 indexed Sprite, then go down to next row, until bottom symbols then continues to next reel
Draws a symbol sprite on each visible symbol on the reels
classitems.name: drawSprites

classitems.description: hide animation at the end of one play
classitems.name: handleAnimationEnd

classitems.description: test symbol anims here

params.name: symbolIndex
params.description: - index in the array where the sprite is stored. Stored in this order reel[0]: t, m, b, reel[1]: t, m, b eg... this.symbols[4] = top symbol in second reel

classitems.description: Store data for telling the win line what to draw
classitems.name: winLineSquares
example: - [1, 1 , 1, 0, 0] to draw winning symbol border boxes in the first 3 then a line in the final 2 [] [] [] - -

classitems.description: Store data required to locate the win line on the reel
classitems.name: symbolLocations
classitems.usage: 0 = top symbol, 1 = middle symbol, 2 = bottom symbol on a 3 line reel.  For greater visible reel height just increase the number
example: - [0,0,0,1,2] would draw the line along the top row of the first 3 reels, then it would go through the next row and the last row in the final reel

classitems.description:
init: Game entry point, create Preloader and accept a Display root (currently createjs.stage), and ServerInterface.
Starts Preloading of assets

params.name: stage
params.description: - The root Display Container which is added to Canvas

params.name: serverInterface
params.description: - Interface for incoming and outgoing server requests

classitems.description: SignalHandler which saves setup data when loaded by Preloader

params.name: setup
params.description: - Setup Object which is loaded from setup.json file

classitems.name: onSetupLoaded

classitems.description:
Signal Handler
onAssetsLoadComplete: Asets have been loaded.  Now initialise the Display,
Initialise UI Events, and Create a SignalDispatcher
classitems.name: onAssetsLoadComplete

classitems.description:
setupDisplay: Start layering Containers and GameComponents.  Mask the stage for reels.
nb. These are potentially expensive cpu operations, but everything done here is done after Preload and during app initialisation.
Any filters applied to display objects will magnify the length of time this function takes to complete.
classitems.name: setupDisplay

classitems.description:
User Control is initialised: Keyboard control / touch controls
if User Control shouldn't be enabled during app initialisation phase, then execute this function later.
todo: - configure a way to turn on/off user interaction events.
classitems.name: initUIEvents

classitems.constant: SETUP_URL - path of setup.json file relative to public root.

classitems.description:
init - store a reference to game, creates a LoadQueue for Setup, creates a LoadQueue for Assets
Defines Event Handlers for LoadQueues
startLoad - starts loading setup.json file
handleSetupLoaded - dispatches a Signal to Game then loads Game assets
loadGameAssets - loads spritesheets defined in Setup
handleAssetsError - handle errors in asset loading phase gracefully
handleAssetsProgress - handle loading of game assets
handleAssetsLoaded - dispatch a Signal to Game containing loaded Assets
Saves reference to Setup and GameComponents
classitems.name: init

classitems.description: Stores reference to Stats, this is a profiling tool which displays FPS and MSPF
classitems.name: stats

classitems.description: Stores a reference to Stage Object, a Special Container which is at the root of the Canvas
classitems.name: stage

classitems.description: Stores a reference to G.Game, Everything a KingKong game is created by this Object or passed into it during initialisation.
classitems.name: game

classitems.description: Application entry point initialises the canvas viewport (currently createjs) and the Game
classitems.name: init

classitems.description: Render Tick which updates Stage and any profiling tool.
classitems.name: handleTick
